1.verse: From the elder, to Gaius my dear brother, whom I love in truth.

2.verse: Dear friend, I pray that in every way you may prosper and be in good health, just as your soul is prospering.

3.verse: For I rejoiced greatly when the brothers came and testified to your fidelity to the truth, as indeed you do walk in the truth.

4.verse: I have no greater joy than this: to hear that my children are walking in the truth.

5.verse: Dear brother, you are faithful in what you are doing for the brothers, even though they are strangers.

6.verse: They have testified to your love before the church. You will do well to help them on their way in a manner worthy of God,

7.verse: because they set out for the sake of the Name, accepting nothing from nonbelievers.

8.verse: Therefore we ought to show hospitality to such men, so that we may be coworkers for the truth.

9.verse: I sent a letter to the church, but Diotrephes, who likes to be in charge, does not acknowledge our authority.

10.verse: For this reason, should I come, I will bring up the things he is doing, disparaging us with malicious talk. And not satisfied with that, he refuses to welcome the brothers. He even prevents those who would like to and puts them out of the church.

11.verse: Dear friend, do not imitate what is evil but what is good. The one who does good is of God; the one who does evil has not seen God.

12.verse: Everyone has testified favorably regarding Demetrius, and so has the truth itself. And we testify for him as well, and you know that our testimony is true.

13.verse: I have many things to write to you, but I do not wish to write with ink and pen.

14.verse: But I hope to see you in the near future, and we will speak face to face.
